00032 // Interface for Int16 type. 
00033 //
00034 // jhrg 9/7/94
00035 
00036 #ifndef _uint16_h
00037 #define _uint16_h 1
00038 
00039 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00040 #ifdef __GNUG__
00041 #pragma interface
00042 #endif
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 #if 0
00046 
00047 #ifdef WIN32
00048 #include <rpc.h>
00049 #include <winsock.h>
00050 #include <xdr.h>
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 #include <rpc/types.h>
00054 #include <netinet/in.h>
00055 #include <rpc/xdr.h>
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #ifndef _dods_datatypes_h
00059 #include "dods-datatypes.h"
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 #ifndef _basetype_h
00063 #include "BaseType.h"
00064 #endif
00065 
00068 class UInt16: public BaseType {
00074     friend class Byte;
00075     friend class Int16;
00076     friend class Int32;
00077     friend class UInt32;
00078     friend class Float32;
00079     friend class Float64;
00080 
00081 protected:
00082     dods_uint16 _buf;
00083 
00084 public:
00085     UInt16(const string &n = "");
00086     virtual ~UInt16() {}
00087 
00088     UInt16(const UInt16 &copy_from);
00089 
00090     UInt16 &operator=(const UInt16 &rhs);
00091 
00092     virtual BaseType *ptr_duplicate();
00093     
00094     virtual unsigned int width();
00095 
00096     virtual bool serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink,
00097                bool ce_eval = true);
00098     virtual bool deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *dds, bool reuse = false);
00099 
00100     virtual unsigned int val2buf(void *val, bool reuse = false);
00101     virtual unsigned int buf2val(void **val);
00102 
00103     virtual void print_val(ostream &os, string space = "",
00104                bool print_decl_p = true);
00105 
00106     virtual void print_val(FILE *out, string space = "",
00107                bool print_decl_p = true);
00108 
00109     virtual bool ops(BaseType *b, int op, const string &dataset);
00110 };

00151 // Revision 1.9  2001/08/24 17:46:22  jimg
00152 // Resolved conflicts from the merge of release 3.2.6

00154 // Revision 1.8.4.1  2001/07/28 01:10:42  jimg
00155 // Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00156 // I added those where they were needed.
00157 // In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00158 // just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00159 // before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00160 // just good form when using delete.
00161 // I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00162 // making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00163 // set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00164 // comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00165 // characters on their own.
00166 //
00167 // Revision 1.8  2000/09/22 02:17:21  jimg
00168 // Rearranged source files so that the CVS logs appear at the end rather than
00169 // the start. Also made the ifdef guard symbols use the same naming scheme and
00170 // wrapped headers included in other headers in those guard symbols (to cut
00171 // down on extraneous file processing - See Lakos).
00172 //
00173 // Revision 1.7  2000/09/21 16:22:09  jimg
00174 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00175 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00176 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00177 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00178 // the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00179 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
